children.subject: Wow, that sounds stressful indeed. Thanks for the advice!

To be fair, I've had the opposite experience. I took Chem 3a and Math 54 my first summer, and then CS 188, MCB 102, and BioE 196 (research) the second summer. I found it to be very manageable, and I liked summer courses way more than semester courses.

I would probably take a breadth course / any course that isn't too time intensive. I made the decision of taking CS61BL and English 1A last summer and it definitely was some of the most stressful times I've had at Berkeley. Nothing was every "too difficult" but in terms of workload, it was absolutely the worst. I still remember the week where we implemented every data structure in Java, had a midterm and project for 61BL, and a 5-7 page paper due for English the same week.

history.content:
I'm currently enrolled in 4 units for the summer, with my other 4 units (CS 188) being waitlisted, so it only shows I have 4 units. Since you need 6 units for being eligible for financial aid for the summer, what should I do at this point?

Also, to clarify, I just enrolled in these classes yesterday, so after 188 was officially added (per @6352).
history.subject: [Summer classes] Waitlisted for CS 188 - financial aid impact?
